official-title.#text: To strengthen United States-Israel science and technology cooperation.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 917(a) of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:917/ss:a

text.#text: by striking the period at the end of paragraph (7) and inserting
by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
should collaborate with the Israel Science
			 Foundation.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Science Foundation of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the
			 Israeli Ministry of Industry and Trade (now the Ministry of Economy) is
			 authorized to facilitate research and development and technology
			 partnerships among United States and Israeli researchers, and business and
			 industrial entities for purposes of advancing technologies, leading to
			 commercialization and domestic manufacturing, and creating benefits for
			 both nations. The

, through the Deputy Secretary’s
			 office and in conjunction with Israel’s Ministry of Economy’s Chief
			 Scientist, shall ensure that the U.S.-Israel Science and Technology
			 Foundation maintains its role as facilitator of the reauthorized 1994
			 Memorandum of Understanding to create and execute joint research and
			 development agreements between Israel and United States entities,
			 including United States Federal agencies, States, cities, businesses,
			 academic institutions, and scientific foundations.

text.#text:
The U.S.-Israel Science and Technology Foundation, created pursuant to the 1994 Memorandum of
